instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: I’m pretty familiar with the rarity of genuine AMD chips for the later A1286s, has anyone had any experience good or bad with trying to find the nVidia chips for the 2010 models. I’ve had a couple requests for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board repairs that don’t exhibit the kernel panics and freezing that I tend to associate with the <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> fix. Are these chips also pretty impossible to find or is it just a matter of checking what suppliers send you before trying to install them?

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: Chips are easy to find because you never need them. What are the issues you have?

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message:
No Title

The traditional kernel panics and freezing that seems like the capacitor fix however it’s got terrible graphics anomalies. I attached a picture of what the particular one is doing.

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: I have found that even replacing the GPU and VRAM this issue will come back. You may try for yourself if you want...

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: Dang is it most likely an unrepairable board issue, is there anyway to extend the life of the board or is it game over?

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: Replace the GPU and VRAM and say a little prayer.

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nVidia GPUs
threads.message: don't waste your time, this pattern is game over. I tried MUX, VRAM, GPU. you will still get the same result, I will vote for the problem on PCB
